Home | Publications | Gravitational Waves |

Gravitational Wave Emission

Radially resolved gravitational wave signal for a 35 solar mass progenitor using the CMF model. The Einstein mass-quadrupole mass formula has been evaluated without integration over radius to resolve radial dependence. The signal corresponds to the $g_2^2$-mode (quadrupole mode with one radial node). Its excitation and frequency are Equation of State dependend. The upper panel shows the modified gravitational wave amplitude at 5km, 6km, and 8km. The bottom plot shows the fourrier transforms for all radii in between 0-100km.

z35:CMF
Written in Julia
